overview: Varkala is a coastal town in Kerala, about 50 km north of Thiruvananthapuram. It is famous for Papanasam Beach, the cliff‑side promenade, the Samadhi of Sree Narayana Guru and several temples such as Janardhana Swamy Temple and Sivagiri Mutt.
bestTimeToVisit: December to March (peak season), with quieter and cheaper conditions in the off‑season.
travelTips: Autorickshaws from the railway station cost about ₹80; walking along the cliff is free and scenic.
Budget rooms start at ₹1,500–₹2,000 per night; book early in peak months.
Seafood is abundant at cliff‑top restaurants; many operate seasonally from late November.
Free yoga sessions are offered by local wellness centres; therapy programs cost ₹700–₹2,500 per day.
Visit in the off‑season (April – November) for lower prices and fewer crowds.
Carry cash for small vendors and tip modestly at restaurants and shacks.
